channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2023101205
item.description:
Report X-2023101205

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-19
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023101205: SUPERVISOR CALLED IN LEAKER TO THE DMP. DMP DISPATCHED A RESPONDER TO THE LEAKER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART. RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO RESPOND. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKER AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO THE DMP AREA. LEAKER WAS PROPERLY DISPOSED OF. 2. X-2023101206: SUPERVISOR CALLED A LEAKER INTO THE DMP. DMP SENT A RESPONDER WITH FULL PPE AND SPILL CART TO THE LEAKER. RESPONDER ARRIVED AT THE SPOT OF THE LEAKER AND CONSULTED THE DECISION TREE ON HOW TO PROCEED. RESPONDER FOLLOWED THE STEPS IN THE DECISION TREE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. RESPONDER BROUGHT THE LEAKER TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023101391
item.description:
Report X-2023101391

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: ALL FOUR BOTTLES WERE LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY A PACKAGE HANDLER WHILE UNLOADING, THEY TOLD THEIR MANAGER AND THEY REPORTED IT TO QA. IT WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINER AND PLACED IN THE PROCESSING CAGE DescribePack: THE LIQUIDS LEAKED THROUGH LOOSE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE WITH A LINER

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered while loading, it was reported to QA by a manger. DescribePack: The liquids leaked through loose caps. Package was an undeclared Hazmat. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was placed in a tote with a liner and brought to QA.

item.title: Report X-2023101264
item.description:
Report X-2023101264

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-17T18:14:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-09
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cushman driver found this package and brought to QA. QA noticed a strong smell and use the PH paper and they noticed that the package was hazmat and they put it in the professing cage in a tote line with a hazmat bag. DescribePack: The gallon is crushed and loose cap about half of the contents spilled out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA put the package in a tote line with a hazmat bag and sliced to the processing cage.

DescribePack: ALL FOUR THE BOTTLES WERE LEKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAPS SOILING THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LIND TOTE.

item.title: Report X-2023100834
item.description:
Report X-2023100834

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-16T18:13:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-03
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: WHILE QA WAS DOING A WALK, THEY NOTICED THIS PACKAGE WAS SITTING UNDERNEATH THE ROLLERS OF THE OUTBOUND AREA. QA PICKED UP THE PACKAGE AND NOTICED IT WAS WET AND LEAKING. THEY PLACED IT IN A TOTE LINED WITH A HAZMAT BAG AND BROUGHT IT BACK TO QA. DescribePack: THE TOPS OF THE CANISTERS WERE DISCOVERED BROKEN OFF, CAUSING THE NOZZLES TO BREAK OFF. DurationRel: 10 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A TOTE LINED WITH A CLEAR, LARGE HAZMAT BAG.

Report X-2023100781

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: A BOX WITH HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS AND A CORROSIVE HAZMAT DIAMOND LABEL WAS LEAKING ON AN OUTBOUND BELT. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX AND ALL RELATED MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

  • Description: X-2023100758-A BOX WITH HAZMAT SHIPPING PAPERS AND A CORROSIVE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL WAS LEAKING ON AN IRREG SLIDE IN THE UNLOAD. A DESIGNATED RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX AND ANY OTHER RELATED BOXES AND MATERIAL IN LINED SPILL TUBS AND TRANSPORTED THEM TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL. X-2023100759-A RESPONDER PLACED THE LEAKING BOX IN A LINED SPILL TUB AND TRANSPORTED IT TO THE DMP FOR PROPER DISPOSAL.

item.title: Report X-2023110016
item.description:
Report X-2023110016

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-21T18:13:39+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-28
  • City: TOPEKA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Around 3:30 am someone from unload brought it over to QA without letting anyone know about it . I found it approximately 3:45 am and questioned who brought it over so I could get details and no one knew who did it. DescribePack: The box appeared to be wet on the bottom and two sides ( mainly on the side with the hazmat papers). I put on gloves and opened the box to see if it was still leaking. It appeared that it had been leaking when tipped on its side probably in transit. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: I kept the box on the cart it was brought over on and put it inside QA cage, and began the damaged Hazmat documentation checklist.
